00032 char nToChar(int n, bool upperCase) {
00033     if (n < 10) return char(n+'0');
00034     else if (upperCase) return char((n - 10) + 'A');
00035     else return char((n - 10) + 'a');
00036 }
00037 
00038 std::string to_string(const base_integer& n, size_t base, bool uppercase) {
00039     if (base<2 || base>36) throw exceptions::invalid_base();
00040 
00041     if (n._is_zero()) return "0";
00042 
00043     std::ostringstream out;
00044     if (base == 2 || base == 4 || base == 16) {
00045         // Fast no-division version, useful for debugging division and for cases
00046         // where maximum speed is necessary.
00047         const digit_t *firstDigit=n._get_digits(),
00048             *lastDigit=firstDigit + n._get_length() - 1;
00049 
00050         if (n._get_negative()) out << '-';
00051 
00052         int bits_per_base_b_digit = 0;
00053         while (base > 1) { base = base >> 1; ++bits_per_base_b_digit; }
00054         const digit_t mask=(doubledigit_t(1) << bits_per_base_b_digit)-1;
00055 
00056         // Skip any leading zeros
00057         const digit_t *d=lastDigit;
00058         int digitShift=(bits_per_digit - bits_per_base_b_digit);
00059         while (digitShift >= 0 && ((*d >> digitShift) & mask) == 0)
00060             digitShift -= bits_per_base_b_digit;
00061 
00062         do {
00063             while (digitShift >= 0) {
00064                 out << nToChar((*d >> digitShift) & mask, uppercase);
00065                 digitShift -= bits_per_base_b_digit;
00066             }
00067 
00068             digitShift=(bits_per_digit - bits_per_base_b_digit);
00069         } while (d-- != firstDigit);
00070 
00071         return out.str();
00072     } else {
00073         // NOTE: for when there's nothing more pressing to do
00074         // This could be made a lot more efficient for very large numbers, by
00075         // dividing n by base raised to whatever number of digits will fit into
00076         // a doubledigit_t, then just doing single-digit divides for that many
00077         // digits before going back to n for another chunk. That would be
00078         // premature optimization though, so I'm just making this note instead.
00079         // If someone can show me a use-case where more efficiency is needed in
00080         // this function, I'll add it later.
00081 
00082         const integer shift(base);
00083         integer::divide_t a(n._to_integer(), integer::zero());
00084         a.quotient._set_negative(false);
00085 
00086         integer r;
00087         while (!a.quotient._is_zero()) {
00088             a = divide_r(a.quotient, shift);
00089             out << nToChar(a.remainder._get_digit(0), uppercase);
00090         }
00091 
00092         if (n._get_negative()) out << '-';
00093 
00094         std::string rval=out.str();
00095         std::reverse(rval.begin(), rval.end());
00096         return rval;
00097     }
00098 }
00099 
00100 void from_string(base_integer& target, const std::string& str, size_t base) {
00101     bool negate=false;
00102     const char *c=str.c_str();
00103     if (*c=='+') ++c;
00104     else if (*c=='-') { negate=true; ++c; }
00105 
00106     if (base==autobase) {
00107         if (*c=='0') {
00108             ++c;
00109             if (*c=='x' || *c=='X') {
00110                 ++c;
00111                 base=16;
00112             } else base=8;
00113         } else base=10;
00114     }
00115 
00116     if (base<2 || base>36) throw exceptions::invalid_base();
00117     if (*c==0) throw exceptions::invalid_digit("No valid digits");
00118 
00119     const integer shift(base);
00120 
00121     // NOTE: for when there's nothing more pressing to do
00122     // This function could use the same efficiency improvements that to_string
00123     // uses, but there's even less need for them here. Show me a use-case where
00124     // they're needed and I'll add them; until then, this will suffice.
00125 
00126     integer r;
00127     while (*c) {
00128         unsigned int digit;
00129         if (*c>='0' && *c<='9') digit=*c-'0';
00130         else if (*c>='A' && *c<='Z') digit=*c-'A'+10;
00131         else if (*c>='a' && *c<='z') digit=*c-'a'+10;
00132         else
00133             throw exceptions::invalid_digit("encountered non-alphanumeric "
00134             "character in string");
00135 
00136         if (digit >= base) throw exceptions::invalid_digit("encountered digit "
00137             "greater than base allows");
00138 
00139         r = (r * shift) + digit;
00140         ++c;
00141     }
00142     r._set_negative(negate);
00143 
00144     target._attach(r);
00145 }
00146 
00147 void to_binary(xint::binary_t& target, const base_integer& n, size_t bits) {
00148     if (bits > size_t(std::numeric_limits<unsigned char>::digits)) throw
00149         exceptions::invalid_argument("can't fit that many bits into an "
00150         "unsigned character on this system");
00151     if (bits == 0) bits = std::numeric_limits<unsigned char>::digits;
00152 
00153     bitqueue_t bitqueue;
00154     const digit_t *s = n._get_digits(), *se = s + n._get_length();
00155     while (s != se) bitqueue.push(*s++, bits_per_digit);
00156 
00157     while (!bitqueue.empty()) target.push_back(static_cast<unsigned char>
00158                 (bitqueue.pop(bits)));
00159     while (!target.empty() && target.back()==0) target.pop_back();
00160 }
00161 
00162 void from_binary(base_integer& target, const xint::binary_t& b, size_t bits) {
00163     if (bits > size_t(std::numeric_limits<unsigned char>::digits)) throw
00164         exceptions::invalid_argument("can't fit that many bits into an "
00165         "unsigned character on this system");
00166     if (bits == 0) bits = std::numeric_limits<unsigned char>::digits;
00167 
00168     bitqueue_t bitqueue;
00169     for (xint::binary_t::const_iterator s = b.begin(), se = b.end(); s != se;
00170         ++s) bitqueue.push(*s, bits);
00171 
00172     size_t rlen = ((b.size() * bits) + bits_per_digit - 1) / bits_per_digit;
00173     temp_t r(target, rlen);
00174     digit_t *t = r._get_writable_digits(), *te = t + r._get_length();
00175     while (t != te && !bitqueue.empty())
00176                 *t++ = static_cast<digit_t>(bitqueue.pop(bits_per_digit));
00177 
00178     r._cleanup();
00179     target._attach(r);
00180 }

00204 std::string to_string(const integer& n, size_t base, bool uppercase) {
00205     return detail::to_string(n, base, uppercase);
00206 }

00212 std::string to_string(const fixed_integer_any& n, size_t base, bool uppercase) {
00213     return detail::to_string(n, base, uppercase);
00214 }

00241 integer from_string(const std::string& str, size_t base) {
00242     integer r;
00243     detail::from_string(r, str, base);
00244     return BOOST_XINT_MOVE(r);
00245 }
00246 
00266 integer from_binary(const xint::binary_t& b, size_t bits) {
00267     integer r;
00268     detail::from_binary(r, b, bits);
00269     return BOOST_XINT_MOVE(r);
00270 }
00271 
00299 xint::binary_t to_binary(const integer& n, size_t bits) {
00300     xint::binary_t r;
00301     detail::to_binary(r, n, bits);
00302     return r;
00303 }
